timeline.bodyText: I think this function is expected to be deterministic and in the PostgreSQL it has variable number of arguments.
timeline.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: It should use false, true, true, false because it doesn't return NULL on any NULL parameter and because it is deterministic.
replies.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText: Such conversion to untyped array will be rejected in the future and PostgreSQL doesn't really accept values of other data types here. You need to check getValueType() and throw DbException.getInvalidValueException(…) if passed value is not an array.
timeline.author: katzyn

timeline.bodyText:
Why v != null is needed here?


Use v == ValueNull.INSTANCE for a null check.


If an optional third argument is specified, it should be used as replacement for null values.
timeline.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: fixed null check and added 3rd arg replacement
replies.author: auntyellow

timeline.bodyText: We prefer pure SQL tests for such functions, see TestScript and .sql files.
timeline.author: katzyn
katzyn

replies.bodyText:
Fixed.
In real PostgreSQL 12, however, 3rd arg can only be NULL or String-like.
replies.author: auntyellow

timeline.bodyText: You need to return ValueNull.INSTANCE if v0 or v1 are equal to ValueNull.INSTANCE before this condition, because this function now processes nulls by itself.
timeline.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: Please, also add test cases for NULL values in the first and second arguments to ensure correctness of the new condition.
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText:
I adjusted test cases:

array_to_string(null, ?, ?) -> null
array_to_string(?, null, ?) -> null
array_to_string(not-array, ?, ?) -> invalid

Although PostgreSQL regards array_to_string(null, <string>) as invalid.
replies.author: auntyellow

replies.bodyText: You need to add an explicit cast to array data type when you test NULL array in the PostgreSQL, it rejects untyped NULL only.
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: You mean array_to_string(null::array, ',') should be considered?
replies.author: auntyellow

replies.bodyText: int array or some other valid array type. In our tests it isn't needed, I meant only how you can test it in the real PostgreSQL correctly.
replies.author: katzyn
auntyellow

timeline.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: But if you want them for a some reason, use DataType.isCharacterStringType() and preserve special case for NULL.
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText:
PostgreSQL also doesn't accept other data types in the second argument, but you don't check it, so I don't understand why you want to check the optional third argument.
First argument is very special and special check for it simplifies implementation, others are simple string arguments, from my point of view these additional conditions for them aren't required. H2 is not designed to validate SQL for other databases anyway.
replies.author: katzyn

replies.bodyText: I just forgot to add 2nd arg type check before. Now 3rd arg type check removed, which made code simpler : - )
replies.author: auntyellow
